page.title: 02GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: To the east of Hedge End is the much older village of Botley.There is a busy main road through the village. Around the village are fields and farms.The fields are mainly full of crops with some grazing land.The crops are mostly strawberries.In the south is the Hamble river.It runs through the Hamble Country Park and Botley village itself.The river used to work a flour mill which is still there today producing flour.Also to the south is Manor farm which is now a museum to show farming techniques in Hampshire between 1850 and 1950.There is a walk from here to the Hamble Country Park which is a large area of woodland beside the river.There is also a stretch of roman road which is now a bridleway.
